intro: Drosera paleacea subsp. roseana, commonly known as the pink sundew, is a carnivorous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, glandular leaves that secrete a sticky digestive fluid to trap insects. The plant produces tall, slender flowering stems with small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and requires high humidity for optimal growth. Its unique appearance and trapping mechanism make it a popular specimen among carnivorous plant enthusiasts.
